resources.string: Search and select the node on your paddle:
Search and select the node on the front paddler\'s paddle:

The sensors can be switched on by pressing once on the button located on the middle of the sensor.

If it is on, it will blink with a blue light.

If it is blinking with a red light, its battery is below 10%.

 If the sensor lamp is pulsating, it is already connected.

1. Make sure the sensors to be used are switched on. Read How To Use The Sensors for further instructions on how to turn on the sensors. Also make sure that the sensors are paired together with the device, this is done in the Bluetooth settings of the device.\n
3. Press SEARCH IMU-SENSOR and activate Bluetooth if prompted. Press on the sensor that is mounted on your paddle. \n
4. Press SEARCH IMU-SENSOR. Press on the sensor that is mounted on the paddle of the front paddler.\n
How To Interpret The Feedback System\n\n
As feedback, you\'ll receive different type of feedback depending on your synchronisation level. You will receive both visual feedback. There are three different synchronisation levels, 1, 2 and 3.\n
In synchronisation level 1, you have achieved full synchronisation with the front paddler. The screen will then be coloured in green during a stroke.\n
In synchronisation level 2, you are a little behind achieving full synchronisation with the front paddler. The screen will then be coloured in yellow during a stroke.\n
In synchronisation level 3, you are far behind achieving full synchronisation with the front paddler. The screen will then be coloured in red during a stroke.\n
How To Place The Sensor On The Paddle\n

Place the sensor on the shaft of the paddle in such way that the button is pointing straight upwards while the paddle is held in a neutral stance in the paddle. A neutral stance implies a stance of the paddle where the paddle is just between the action of doing a left paddle stroke and the action of doing a right paddle stroke. Both of the sensors, the one on the front paddler\'s paddle and the one of the user paddler\'s paddle, should be placed on the left side of the right hand, from the paddler\'s perspective. The sensor should be oriented in such a way that the cover for the charging port of the sensor is faced towards the paddler.\n
The max time difference in milliseconds which will be accepted in order to reach synchronisation level 1.
The max time difference in milliseconds which will be accepted in order to reach synchronisation level 2.
